title: Why are shorter objects harder to bend than longer objects? - Quora

response.answer_text: The most important aspect is the material: Cupper is easier to bend the iron. It’s all in the metallurgical/chemical characteristics of the material. A second reason is the ratio length/wide: a thin wire is easier to bend than a thick tube. Last, but not least, is your force! If you are a tiny person without physical training it will be harder.
